cluster_description: The Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics Cluster provides a means to acquire standardized diagnostics metrics that MAY be used by a Node to assist a user or Administrator in diagnosing potential problems. The Wi-Fi Network Diagnostics Cluster attempts to centralize all metrics that are relevant to a potential Wi-Fi radio running on a Node.

PKTCNT.name: PacketCounts
PKTCNT.summary: Node makes available the counts for the number of received and transmitted packets on the Wi-Fi interface.

ERRCNT.name: ErrorCounts
ERRCNT.summary: Node makes available the counts for the number of errors that have occurred during the reception and transmission of packets on the Wi-Fi interface.

values.name: Unspecified
values.summary: Indicate the usage of an unspecified Wi-Fi security type

values.name: None
values.summary: Indicate the usage of no Wi-Fi security

values.name: WEP
values.summary: Indicate the usage of WEP Wi-Fi security

values.name: WPA
values.summary: Indicate the usage of WPA Wi-Fi security

values.name: WPA2
values.summary: Indicate the usage of WPA2 Wi-Fi security

values.name: WPA3
values.summary: Indicate the usage of WPA3 Wi-Fi security

values.name: a
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11a against the wireless access point.

values.name: b
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11b against the wireless access point.

values.name: g
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11g against the wireless access point.

values.name: n
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11n against the wireless access point.

values.name: ac
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11ac against the wireless access point.

values.name: ax
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11ax against the wireless access point.

values.name: ah
values.summary: Indicate the network interface is currently using 802.11ah against the wireless access point.

values.name: Unknown
values.summary: The reason for the failure is unknown.

values.name: SsidNotFound
values.summary: The specified SSID could not be found.

values.name: NotConnected
values.summary: Indicate the node is not connected

attributes.name: BSSID
attributes.description: The BSSID attribute SHALL indicate the BSSID for which the Wi-Fi network the Node is currently connected.

attributes.name: SecurityType
attributes.description: The SecurityType attribute SHALL indicate the current type of Wi-Fi security used.

attributes.name: WiFiVersion
attributes.description: The WiFiVersion attribute SHALL indicate the current 802.11 standard version in use by the Node.

attributes.name: ChannelNumber
attributes.description: The ChannelNumber attribute SHALL indicate the channel that Wi-Fi communication is currently operating on.

attributes.name: RSSI
attributes.description: The RSSI attribute SHALL indicate the current RSSI of the Node's Wi-Fi radio in dBm.

attributes.name: BeaconLostCount
attributes.description: The BeaconLostCount attribute SHALL indicate the count of the number of missed beacons the Node has detected. If the Node does not have an ability to count beacons expected and not received, this value MAY remain set to zero.

attributes.name: BeaconRxCount
attributes.description: The BeaconRxCount attribute SHALL indicate the count of the number of received beacons. The total number of expected beacons that could have been received during the interval since association SHOULD match the sum of BeaconRxCount and BeaconLostCount. If the Node does not have an ability to report count of beacons received, this value MAY remain set to zero.

attributes.name: PacketMulticastRxCount
attributes.description: The PacketMulticastRxCount attribute SHALL indicate the number of multicast packets received by the Node.

attributes.name: PacketMulticastTxCount
attributes.description: The PacketMulticastTxCount attribute SHALL indicate the number of multicast packets transmitted by the Node.

attributes.name: PacketUnicastRxCount
attributes.description: The PacketUnicastRxCount attribute SHALL indicate the number of unicast packets received by the Node.

attributes.name: PacketUnicastTxCount
attributes.description: The PacketUnicastTxCount attribute SHALL indicate the number of unicast packets transmitted by the Node.

attributes.name: CurrentMaxRate
attributes.description: The CurrentMaxRate attribute SHALL indicate the current maximum PHY rate of transfer of data in bits-per-second.

attributes.name: OverrunCount
attributes.description: The OverrunCount attribute SHALL indicate the number of packets dropped either at ingress or egress, due to lack of buffer memory to retain all packets on the network interface. The OverrunCount attribute SHALL be reset to 0 upon a reboot of the Node.

commands.name: ResetCounts
commands.description: Reception of this command SHALL reset the following attributes to 0: BeaconLostCount, BeaconRxCount, PacketMulticastRxCount, PacketMulticastTxCount, PacketUnicastRxCount, PacketUnicastTxCount. This command has no associated data.

events.name: Disconnection

fields.name: ReasonCode
fields.description: This field SHALL contain the Reason Code field value for the Disassociation or Deauthentication event that caused the disconnection and the value SHALL align with Table 9-49 "Reason codes" of IEEE 802.11-2020.

events.description: The Disconnection Event SHALL indicate that a Node's Wi-Fi connection has been disconnected as a result of de-authenticated or dis-association and indicates the reason.

events.name: AssociationFailure

fields.name: AssociationFailureCause
fields.description: The AssociationFailureCause field SHALL be set to a value from the AssociationFailureCauseEnum.

fields.name: Status
fields.description: The Status field SHALL be set to the Status Code value that was present in the last frame related to association where Status Code was not equal to zero and which caused the failure of a last trial attempt, if this last failure was due to one of the following Management frames: Association Response (Type 0, Subtype 1), Reassociation Response (Type 0, Subtype 3), Authentication (Type 0, Subtype 11). Table 9-50 "Status codes" of IEEE 802.11-2020 contains a description of all values possible.

events.description: The AssociationFailure event SHALL indicate that a Node has attempted to connect, or reconnect, to a Wi-Fi access point, but is unable to successfully associate or authenticate, after exhausting all internal retries of its supplicant.

events.name: ConnectionStatus

fields.name: ConnectionStatus
fields.description: The ConnectionStatus Event SHALL indicate that a Node's connection status to a Wi-Fi network has changed. Connected, in this context, SHALL mean that a Node acting as a Wi-Fi station is successfully associated to a Wi-Fi Access Point.

events.description: The ConnectionStatus Event SHALL indicate that a Node's connection status to a Wi-Fi network has changed.
